<section id="workshop-details" style="padding: 40px 20px; text-align: center;">
  <h2>About the Workshop</h2>
  <p>Single-cell sequencing technologies are powerful tools used to assess genomic, transcriptomic, and proteomic information at the single-cell level. 
  In recent years, the application of techniques that use single-cell sequencing has become increasingly common in several areas of research: including medicine, 
  agriculture, and other life sciences disciplines. The workshop focuses on providing hands-on experience and in-depth bioinformatics training to ensure participants 
  gain a strong foundation in single-cell methodologies.</p>

  <h3>Learning Outcomes</h3>
  <ul style="list-style-type: none; padding: 0; text-align: central; max-width: 800px; margin: 0 auto;">
    <li><strong>Module 1:</strong> Preprocessing of raw scRNA-seq data using various methods (10X Genomics, CEL-seq2, etc.).</li>
    <li><strong>Module 2:</strong> Quality control, exploratory analysis, normalization, clustering, and differential expression analysis.</li>
    <li><strong>Module 3:</strong> Data integration and batch-effect correction using Seurat and Harmony.</li>
    <li><strong>Module 4:</strong> Deciphering cell-cell communication using LIANA.</li>
    <li><strong>Module 5:</strong> BCR/TCR profiling and CITE-Seq in single-cell analysis.</li>
    <li><strong>Module 6:</strong> Trajectory inference and pseudotemporal ordering using Monocle3.</li>
  </ul>

  <h3>Funding and Collaborators</h3>
  <ul style="list-style-type: none; padding: 0; text-align: central; max-width: 800px; margin: 0 auto;">

<!-- Slideshow JavaScript -->
<script>
  let slideIndex = 0;
  const slides = document.querySelectorAll('.mySlides');
  
  function showSlides() {
    slides.forEach((slide) => {
      slide.style.opacity = '0';  // Hide all slides
    });
    
    slideIndex++;
    if (slideIndex > slides.length) { slideIndex = 1; }  // Loop back to first slide
    
    slides[slideIndex - 1].style.opacity = '1';  // Show the current slide
    setTimeout(showSlides, 3000);  // Change image every 3 seconds
  }

  document.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", function() {
    showSlides();  // Initialize the slideshow once the DOM is ready
  });
</script>
